title: Objects thrown and dropped on planet

content.question: An object is dropped near the surface of a planet such that the gravitational field at the objectâ€™s location is <math alttext="8 newtons per kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the object is thrown upward at a speed of <math alttext="20 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is the position of the object in relation to the position in which the object was released and thrown upward after <math alttext="3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
